verses.verse: (For the choir director. A Psalm of David.) O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> Thou hast searched <S%H2713><s%> me and known <S%H3045><s%> [me.]
Thou dost know <S%H3045><s%> when I sit <S%H3427><s%> down <S%H3427><s%> and when I rise <S%H6965><s%> up; Thou dost understand <S%H995><s%> my thought <S%H7454><s%> from afar. <S%H7350><s%>

Thou dost scrutinize <S%H2219><s%> my path <S%H734><s%> and my lying <S%H7250><s%> down, <S%H7250><s%> And art intimately <S%H5532><s%> acquainted <S%H5532><s%> with all <S%H3605><s%> my ways. <S%H1870><s%>
Even before there <S%H369><s%> is a word <S%H4405><s%> on my tongue, <S%H3956><s%> Behold, <S%H2005><s%> O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> Thou dost know <S%H3045><s%> it all. <S%H3605><s%>
Thou hast enclosed <S%H6696><s%> me behind <S%H268><s%> and before, <S%H6924><s%> And laid <S%H7896><s%> Thy hand <S%H3709><s%> upon me.
[Such] knowledge <S%H1847><s%> is too <S%H4480><s%> wonderful <S%H6383><s%> for me; It is [too] high, <S%H7682><s%> I cannot <S%H3201><s%> <S%H3808><s%> attain to it.
Where <S%H575><s%> can I go <S%H1980><s%> from Thy Spirit <S%H7307><s%>? Or where <S%H575><s%> can I flee <S%H1272><s%> from Thy presence <S%H6440><s%>?

If <S%H518><s%> I ascend <S%H9368><s%> to heaven, <S%H8064><s%> Thou art there; <S%H8033><s%> If I make <S%H3331><s%> my bed <S%H3331><s%> in Sheol, <S%H7585><s%> behold, <S%H2009><s%> Thou art there.
If I take <S%H5375><s%> the wings <S%H3671><s%> of the dawn, <S%H7837><s%> If I dwell <S%H7931><s%> in the remotest <S%H319><s%> part <S%H319><s%> of the sea, <S%H3220><s%>
Even <S%H1571><s%> there <S%H8033><s%> Thy hand <S%H3027><s%> will lead <S%H5148><s%> me, And Thy right <S%H3225><s%> hand <S%H3225><s%> will lay <S%H270><s%> hold <S%H270><s%> of me.
If I say, <S%H559><s%> "Surely <S%H389><s%> the darkness <S%H2822><s%> will overwhelm <S%H7779><s%> me, And the light <S%H216><s%> around <S%H1157><s%> me will be night, <S%H3915><s%>"

Even <S%H1571><s%> the darkness <S%H2822><s%> is not dark <S%H2821><s%> to Thee, And the night <S%H3915><s%> is as bright <S%H215><s%> as the day. <S%H3117><s%> Darkness <S%H2825><s%> and light <S%H9004><s%> are alike [to Thee.]
For Thou didst form <S%H7069><s%> my inward <S%H3629><s%> parts; <S%H3629><s%> Thou didst weave <S%H9360><s%> me in my mother's womb. <S%H990><s%>

I will give <S%H3034><s%> thanks <S%H3034><s%> to Thee, for I am fearfully <S%H3372><s%> and wonderfully <S%H6395><s%> made; Wonderful <S%H6381><s%> are Thy works, <S%H4639><s%> And my soul <S%H5315><s%> knows <S%H3045><s%> it very <S%H3966><s%> well. <S%H3966><s%>

My frame <S%H6108><s%> was not hidden <S%H3582><s%> from Thee, When <S%H834><s%> I was made <S%H6213><s%> in secret, <S%H5643><s%> [And] skillfully <S%H7551><s%> wrought <S%H7551><s%> in the depths <S%H8482><s%> of the earth. <S%H776><s%>

Thine eyes <S%H5869><s%> have seen <S%H7200><s%> my unformed <S%H1564><s%> substance; <S%H1564><s%> And in Thy book <S%H5612><s%> they were all <S%H3605><s%> written, <S%H3789><s%> The days <S%H3117><s%> that were ordained <S%H3335><s%> [for me], When as yet there was not one <S%H259><s%> of them.
How <S%H4100><s%> precious <S%H3365><s%> also are Thy thoughts <S%H7454><s%> to me, O God! <S%H410><s%> How <S%H4100><s%> vast <S%H6105><s%> is the sum <S%H7218><s%> of them!
If I should count <S%H5608><s%> them, they would outnumber <S%H7235><s%> the sand. <S%H2344><s%> When I awake, <S%H9516><s%> I am still <S%H5750><s%> with Thee.
O <S%H518><s%> that Thou wouldst slay <S%H6991><s%> the wicked, <S%H7563><s%> O God; <S%H433><s%> Depart <S%H5493><s%> from me, therefore, men <S%H376><s%> of bloodshed. <S%H1818><s%>
For they speak <S%H559><s%> against Thee wickedly, <S%H4209><s%> And Thine enemies <S%H6145><s%> take <S%H5375><s%> [Thy name] in vain. <S%H7723><s%>
Do I not hate <S%H8130><s%> those who hate <S%H8130><s%> Thee, O Lord <S%H3068><s%>? And do I not loathe <S%H6962><s%> those who rise <S%H6965><s%> up against Thee?
I hate <S%H8130><s%> them with the utmost <S%H8503><s%> hatred; <S%H8135><s%> They have become <S%H1961><s%> my enemies. <S%H340><s%>
Search <S%H2713><s%> me, O God, <S%H410><s%> and know <S%H3045><s%> my heart; <S%H3824><s%> Try <S%H974><s%> me and know <S%H3045><s%> my anxious <S%H8312><s%> thoughts; <S%H8312><s%>
And see <S%H7200><s%> if <S%H518><s%> there be any hurtful <S%H6090><s%> way <S%H1870><s%> in me, And lead <S%H5148><s%> me in the everlasting <S%H5769><s%> way. <S%H1870><s%>
